C

choose() - Method in class Door
Sets this door as selected by the player.

D

Door - Class in <Unnamed>
The class Door stores the information about one of the door: does it have the prize behind it? Is it open or closed? Was it selected by the player? It provides other objects access to these information through some setters and getters.
Door(String) - Constructor for class Door
Creates an instance of the Door object.

G

getName() - Method in class Door
 

H

hasPrize() - Method in class Door
Checks if the door has the prize.

I

isChosen() - Method in class Door
Checks if the door is selected by the player.
isOpen() - Method in class Door
Checks if the door is open.

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class MontyHall
The main method of this program.
MontyHall - Class in <Unnamed>
The class MontyHall simulates one or several games.
MontyHall() - Constructor for class MontyHall
Initializes the variables.

O

oneGame() - Method in class MontyHall
Simulates one Monty Hall game.
open() - Method in class Door
Sets this door open.

R

reset() - Method in class Door
Resets the door to its initial state: closed, without a prize behind it and not chosen by the player.
runGames(int, boolean) - Method in class MontyHall
Runs a series of Monty Hall games and displays the resulting statistics in a message dialog or on the standard output

S

setPrize() - Method in class Door
Puts the prize behind this door.
Statistics - Class in <Unnamed>
The class Statistics accumulates information about a series of games: Number of game played Number of times the switching strategy was successful Number of times the switching strategy was not successful Number of times each door has the prize behind it Number of times each door was chosen by the player Number of times each door was open by the host
Statistics() - Constructor for class Statistics
Initializes the statistics.

T

toString() - Method in class Statistics
 

U

updateStatistics(Door, Door, Door) - Method in class Statistics
Updates statistics after one game.
